 088:     """
 089:     Convert RGB color model into HSV
 090:     This method is identical to the python library colorsys.rgb_to_hsv
 091:     * Don't forget to free the memory allocated for hsv values if you are 
 092:     calling the method without using the cpdef function (see interface section).
 093:     (Use the same pointer address returned by malloc() to free the block)
 094:     
 095:     :param r: python float; red in range[0 ... 1.0]
 096:     :param g: python float; green in range [0 ... 1.0]
 097:     :param b: python float; blue in range [0 ... 1.0]
 098:     :return: Return HSV values 
 099:     
 100:     to convert in % do the following :
 101:     h = h * 360.0
 102:     s = s * 100.0
 103:     v = v * 100.0
 104:     
 105:     """
 106:     cdef:
 107:         double mx, mn
 108:         double h, df, s, v, df_
+109:         double *hsv = <double *> malloc(3 * sizeof(double))
  __pyx_v_hsv = ((double *)malloc((3 * (sizeof(double)))));

 110: 
+111:     mx = fmax_rgb_value(r, g, b)
  __pyx_v_mx = fmax_rgb_value(__pyx_v_r, __pyx_v_g, __pyx_v_b);

+112:     mn = fmin_rgb_value(r, g, b)
  __pyx_v_mn = fmin_rgb_value(__pyx_v_r, __pyx_v_g, __pyx_v_b);

 113: 
+114:     df = mx - mn
  __pyx_v_df = (__pyx_v_mx - __pyx_v_mn);

+115:     df_ = 1.0/df
  __pyx_v_df_ = (1.0 / __pyx_v_df);

+116:     if mx == mn:
  __pyx_t_1 = ((__pyx_v_mx == __pyx_v_mn) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {
/* … */
    goto __pyx_L3;
  }

+117:         h = 0.0
    __pyx_v_h = 0.0;

 118: 
+119:     elif mx == r:
  __pyx_t_1 = ((__pyx_v_mx == __pyx_v_r) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {
/* … */
    goto __pyx_L3;
  }

+120:         h = (60 * ((g-b) * df_) + 360) % 360
    __pyx_v_h = fmod(((60.0 * ((__pyx_v_g - __pyx_v_b) * __pyx_v_df_)) + 360.0), 360.0);

+121:     elif mx == g:
  __pyx_t_1 = ((__pyx_v_mx == __pyx_v_g) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {
/* … */
    goto __pyx_L3;
  }

+122:         h = (60 * ((b-r) * df_) + 120) % 360
    __pyx_v_h = fmod(((60.0 * ((__pyx_v_b - __pyx_v_r) * __pyx_v_df_)) + 120.0), 360.0);

+123:     elif mx == b:
  __pyx_t_1 = ((__pyx_v_mx == __pyx_v_b) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {
/* … */
  }
  __pyx_L3:;

+124:         h = (60 * ((r-g) * df_) + 240) % 360
    __pyx_v_h = fmod(((60.0 * ((__pyx_v_r - __pyx_v_g) * __pyx_v_df_)) + 240.0), 360.0);

+125:     if mx == 0:
  __pyx_t_1 = ((__pyx_v_mx == 0.0) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {
/* … */
    goto __pyx_L4;
  }

+126:         s = 0.0
    __pyx_v_s = 0.0;

 127:     else:
+128:         s = df/mx
  /*else*/ {
    __pyx_v_s = (__pyx_v_df / __pyx_v_mx);
  }
  __pyx_L4:;

+129:     v = mx
  __pyx_v_v = __pyx_v_mx;

+130:     hsv[0] = h * ONE_360
  (__pyx_v_hsv[0]) = (__pyx_v_h * 0.002777777777777778);

+131:     hsv[1] = s
  (__pyx_v_hsv[1]) = __pyx_v_s;

+132:     hsv[2] = v
  (__pyx_v_hsv[2]) = __pyx_v_v;

+133:     return hsv

+139: cdef double * hsv2rgb_c(double h, double s, double v)nogil:
static double *__pyx_f_3HSV_hsv2rgb_c(double __pyx_v_h, double __pyx_v_s, double __pyx_v_v) {
  int __pyx_v_i;
  double __pyx_v_f;

 140:     """
 141:     Convert hsv color model to rgb
 142:     * Don't forget to free the memory allocated for rgb values if you are 
 143:     calling the method without using the cpdef function (see interface section).
 144:     (Use the same pointer address returned by malloc() to free the block)
 145: 
 146:     :param h: python float; hue in range [0.0 ... 1.0]
 147:     :param s: python float; saturation   [0.0 ... 1.0] 
 148:     :param v: python float; value        [0.0 ... 1.0]
 149:     :return: Return RGB floating values (normalized [0.0 ... 1.0]).
 150:              multiply (red * 255.0, green * 255.0, blue * 255.0) to get the right pixel color.
 151:     """
 152:     cdef:
+153:         int i = 0
  __pyx_v_i = 0;

 154:         double f, p, q, t
+155:         double *rgb = <double *> malloc(3 * sizeof(double))
  __pyx_v_rgb = ((double *)malloc((3 * (sizeof(double)))));

 156: 
+157:     if s == 0.0:
  __pyx_t_1 = ((__pyx_v_s == 0.0) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {
/* … */
  }

+158:         rgb[0] = v
    (__pyx_v_rgb[0]) = __pyx_v_v;

+159:         rgb[1] = v
    (__pyx_v_rgb[1]) = __pyx_v_v;

+160:         rgb[2] = v
    (__pyx_v_rgb[2]) = __pyx_v_v;

+161:         return rgb
    __pyx_r = __pyx_v_rgb;
    goto __pyx_L0;

 162: 
+163:     i = <int>(h * 6.0)
  __pyx_v_i = ((int)(__pyx_v_h * 6.0));

+164:     f = (h * 6.0) - i
  __pyx_v_f = ((__pyx_v_h * 6.0) - __pyx_v_i);

+165:     p = v*(1.0 - s)
  __pyx_v_p = (__pyx_v_v * (1.0 - __pyx_v_s));

+166:     q = v*(1.0 - s * f)
  __pyx_v_q = (__pyx_v_v * (1.0 - (__pyx_v_s * __pyx_v_f)));
